text: Adam Isaac Peter Chotem (born June 19, 1992), known professionally as Adam Fox, is a Canadian-American actor from Vancouver, Canada. He is known for his lead role as "Bud" in the OutTV original Canadian television series Sugar Highs, created by Thom Fitzgeraldhttps://www.amazon.com/prime- video/actor/Thom-Fitzgerald/amzn1.dv.gti.b5874667-2af0-4753-a152-e69fcce50916/ for which he was a Leo Awards nominee for Best Lead Performance Male in a Dramatic Series at the 25th Leo Awards in 2023. He also appeared on CTV The Social to promote the premiere of season 2 of Sugar Highs. He has also appeared as a recurring guest star in CBS' The Holiday Shift, supporting roles in Riverdale, the Tubi original horror movieThe Deep Web: Murdershow, and Bollywood film Best of Luck. Adam appeared in his first bilingual role in 2023 on Ici Radio-Canada Télé program Le Monde de Gabrielle Roy, which he discussed in a French radio interview with Radio Canada. == Personal life == He is also the grandson of pianist and composer Neil Chotem. == References == ==Other websites== * Category:21st-century Canadian actors Category:Canadian movie actors Category:Canadian television actors Category:Canadian web series actors Category:Actors from British Columbia Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Adam Fox (actor)
